title: Q7 Punctuation MC
prompt: Which of these sentences does <u>not</u> have an error in punctuation?
feedback: The correct answer is "When a circuit is connected to the anode and cathode, the electrons move through the circuit." The clause “when a circuit is connected to the anode and cathode” is a dependent clause. A subordinating conjunction such as “when” or “because” shows that the clause can’t stand alone as a sentence. There should be a comma after “cathode” to separate the dependent clause from the independent clause. Using a period or a semicolon after an independent clause is incorrect; the dependent clause becomes a fragment. The sentence “Once electricity is flowing, in the circuit it can be used, to power an electric device” has two unnecessary commas. There should be one comma at the end of the dependent clause, after the word “circuit.”
